author: @aadhavanmahendiran8074
text: // To list down available directory ls //present working directory pwd // to get all the file in the vertical list ls -l // to clear everything in the screen clear //What all the things the linux trying to do man ls // to create the directory test1 mkdir test1 // to get into any of the directory.like get into test1 directory cd  ///ways to create the file vi text1.txt --you can give any kind of extension --to save this file press 'esc'and':wq' //to check what is the data inside the test1.txt file cat test1.txt //to remove this file rm test1.txt //to go 1 step back in the directory cd .. // the ways to go to the home directory or root directory cd ../ ../ cd ../ cd - //to go to the cloudera directory cd home/ cd cloudera/ //if I have to copy the file from 1 location to another location or 1 path to another path copying the test2.txt to test3  cp /home/cloudera/test2/test2.txt /home/cloudera/test3  // if you want to move the file permanently from 1 directory to another directory  mv /home/cloudera/test2/test2.txt /home/cloudera/test3  // to check the permision in the folder home/cloudera you can see that some of the folders with '-r' and some of the folders with 'd' all the files whcich starts with 'd' is simply known as directory // how will be able to give permision to any file we dont get permision to perform read, write to the file starts with '-r' //to give the permision chmod 777 test.txt -- Now all the permision is given to this particular file // Now if we want to give the permision to the directory  //as well as the files inside the directoy in the single shot chmod -R 777 test
